intro: Coptosapelta parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered coptosapelta, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically features trifoliate leaves and produces yellow or greenish-yellow blooms. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
